answers.answer: Thanks for using the forum.Do you have high blood pressure when you are not pregnant? Do you take any blood pressure medications? My best recommendation would be to talk to your doctor about your concerns. There may be dietary and activity restrictions that your doctor want you to be aware of. Your doctor will want to follow you closely throughout your pregnancy to make sure that your blood pressure remains under control.Congratulations on your pregnancy!Cathy

question: I am expecting my second child. My first i had preeclampsia and had an emergency induction at 36 weeks. I am currently 13 weeks and 5 days, had my first check up yesterday. I already have high blood pressure. What are the procedures of dealing with this so early in the pregnancy? Thank you
title: high blood pressure.
